14:52:32","date_last_updated":"2019-09-30 15:00:19","deck":"An arcade style cricket game.","description":"

Overview

Big Bash Boom is a cricket game developed and published by Big Ant Studios for PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, and Nintendo Switch.

System Requirements

PC

PC MinimumPC Recommended
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • Operating System: Windows 7 (x64) or higher
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-3210 / AMD Athlon II X4 555
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon HD 6670 or NVIDIA Geforce GT710 with Min 2GB Memory
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 9 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Controller Required
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • Operating System: Windows 7 (x64) or higher
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4200 / AMD Phenom II X4 970
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon R9 390X or NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 with minimum 2GB Memory
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 9 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Controller Required

External Links

  • Big Bash Boom Official Site

Boum Nicky Boom - Classic Platformer Nicky Boom Lite","api_detail_url":"https://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-17083/","date_added":"2008-04-01 16:31:39","date_last_updated":"2015-11-14 14:26:28","deck":"After an evil sorceress Zoldrane kidnapped little Nicky's grandpa, he sets out to defeat the witch and save his grandfather in this action platformer.","description":"

Overview

Nicky Boom is an action/platformer developed and published on multiple platforms by Microïds. On June 30th, 2009 an iOS port was developed by DotEmu and published by Chillingo.

The game is also known as Nicky Boum. It was followed by the sequel titled Nicky 2.

01:40:40","date_last_updated":"2013-11-11 02:34:38","deck":"Boom Boom Rocket is an Xbox Live Marketplace rhythm game where the goal is to blow up fireworks over a city in tune with techno/trance music inspired by classical scores.","description":"

Overview

Boom Boom Rocket is the first rhythm game released on the Xbox LIVE Marketplace. The object of the game is to make ascending rockets explode as they pass through a marker line on the screen - more or less like Dance Dance Revolution or an inverted Guitar Hero. The main difference is that you actually do not "play" a separated guitar track as you do in Guitar Hero or Rock Band instead you are blowing up rockets in time with the music. The rockets have four different colours - one for each face button on the Xbox 360 controller.

Controllers

Due to the success of Guitar Hero, Dance Dance Revolution and other rhythm games, the developers decided to make some of the peripherals compatible with the game.

Guitar

Playing with the guitar peripheral is just like playing Guitar Hero: you hold the fret buttons down and strum when you want them to explode.

Drum Kit

The Rock Band drum set is also compatible. This actually enhances the gameplay, since hitting drumpads feels more like blowing things up than strumming on a guitar. However, the drum set takes some getting used to, since the order of the colours on the drum set doesn't match the in-game order.

Dance Mat

When using the DDR Universe dance mat, all rockets have arrows on them, which correspond with the dance mat panels. When a rocket crosses the marker line you step on the appropriate dance mat panel to make it explode.

Supported Controllers:

  • Xbox 360 controller
  • Guitar Hero II guitar
  • Guitar Hero III guitar
  • Guitar Hero: Aerosmith guitar
  • Guitar Hero: World Tour guitar/drums
  • Guitar Hero: Metallica guitar
  • Guitar Hero 5 guitar/drums
  • Band Hero guitar/drums
  • Rock Band drums
  • DDR Universe 3 dance mat

Unconfirmed controllers:

  • Scene it? controllers
  • Rock Band guitar
  • Rock Band 2 guitar
  • Rack Band 2 drums

Tracklist

The game currently features fifteen tracks, five of which were added through DLC. Each track is a remixed classical song to make it sound more modern with styles such as ska, funk and trance. The music was composed by Ian Livingstone, famous for the soundtracks of Batman Returns and Project Gotham Racing 2.

The original ten songs that came with the game are:

  • Smooth Operetta (a take on 'Flowers of Duet')
  • Rave New World (a take on 'From The New World')
  • William Tell Overload (a take on 'William Tell Overture')
  • Hall of the Mountain Dude (a take on 'In The Hall of The Mountain King')
  • 1812 Overdrive ('1812 Overture')
  • Valkyries Rising ('Ryde of The Valkyries')
  • Tall Light Sonata ('Piano Sonata No.14 by Beethoven)
  • Carmen Electric (Carmen the Opera, possibly a play on Carmen Electra)
  • Game Over Beethoven ('Symphony No. 5 by Beethoven, possibly a play on 'Roll Over Beethoven")
  • Toccata and Funk ('Toccata and Fugue by Bach')

On November 30th, 2007 five new tracks were added as part of the DLC pack called Rock Pack, which was free for a limited time. It now costs 250 points. The tracks in the DLC Pack are:

  • Sting of the Bumble Bee (Flight of the Bumblebee)
  • Explode to Joy (Ode to Joy)
  • Sugar High (The Nutcracker)
  • Eine Kleine Rochtmusik (Eine Kleine Nachtmusik by Mozart)
  • Cannon in D (Pachelbel's Canon)

09:06:04","date_last_updated":"2017-07-28 22:26:47","deck":"Sonic and his friends have another Boomtastic adventure on the 3DS.","description":"

Overview

Sonic Boom: Fire & Ice (known in Japan as Sonic Toon: Fire & Ice) is a 2.5D side-scrolling platformer developed by Sanzaru and published by Sega for the Nintendo 3DS on September 27, 2016.

It is the sequel to Sonic Boom: Shattered Crystal and the fourth game in the Sonic Boom series (based on the French-American CGI-animated television series of the same name, itself a spin-off of the Sonic the Hedgehog game series).

This game follows Sonic the Hedgehog and his five companions (Tails, Knuckles, Amy, and Sticks) as they work together to foil the plans of Dr. Eggman (who have begun mining a newly-discovered element known as Ragnium) and Eggman mining robot D-Fekt (who uses his malfunctioning magnetic powers to become more powerful).

Like Shattered Crystal, players can switch between each of the five heroes, each with their own special abilities. New to the game is the ability to manipulate fire and ice elements for the heroes' advantage.
